page.title: 01The area around Sulgrave
page.content: This area contains the villages of Thorpe Mandeville and Sulgrave with populations of 179 and 321 respectively. The land stands on a limestone belt stretching from Dorset to Whitby in Yorkshire.The ground undulates gently and the fields are large,surrounded by hedges.The source of the river Tow or Tove is to be found in the fields north of Sulgrave.The only major road is the Banbury Lane running between Banbury and Northampton. The majority of houses in both villages are built of stone,the oldest ones with undressed stone quarried in nearby Helmdon.Today the only building taking place is infilling on small plots of land or the conversion of old farm buildings into residential accommodation.Employment,in general, has to be found outside the area.
